docBody.head: EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM TO BE LAUNCHED HERE
Birth Control Leader Tells Plan Progress

p.q: Just back from a tour of the Western States, Miss Gladys Delancey Smith , regional director of the National Committee on Federal Legislation for Birth Control, will direct attention to an educational program.
In receipt of communication from Mrs. Margaret Sanger, president and founder of the national committee, Miss Smith is jubilant. The Sanger letter states:

docBody.p: “The greatest legal victory in the birth control movement was just won when the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit unanimously upheld Judge Moscowitz's decision liberating the medical profession, hospitals and other health agencies from legal restrictions.

“We are proceeding on two fronts, judicial and legislative, and this decision has established our claim so clearly that there is now no need for us to ask Congress for further legislation regarding the rights of the medical profession.

“This victory is due in large measure to the pressure of public opinion, as clearly shown not only by the millions who have endorsed our Federal work but also by the recent poll of the Institute of Public Opinion.”

p.q: That it is the duty of licensed physicians to aid in the committee's educational program is the belief of Mrs. Sanger who has established headquarters here at 350 South Figueroa Street, Studio D, with Miss Smith in charge. Plans are being perfected by Miss Smith for the formal reception and entertainment of Baronness Ishimoto of Japan, who will arrive here January 25. She is known as the "Margaret Sanger" of Japan.
